Question Text
1. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
2. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must not drive past this sign.
column8: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.

column2: 3. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 4. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 5. This sign indicates:
column4: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.

column2: 7. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
8. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column8: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column2: 9. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column6: As close as possible to the center line.
column8: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 10. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
11. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 12. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column6: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column8: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

column2: 13. Most signs used in street work areas are:
14. Upon a second DUI conviction the violator will serve not less than ____ in jail.
15. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column4: move to the lane on their left.
column8: move to the lane on their right.

column2: 16. Drivers should change lanes:
17. This sign means:
18. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.

column2: 19. This sign indicates:
20. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 21. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.

23. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column8: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 24. Which shape is a stop sign?
25. This road sign means:
column4: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 26. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column6: speed up and proceed through the intersection.
column8: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.

28. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
29. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column6: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
